tn.text: This is a way to introduce a new person to the storyline. (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:writing_participants]])
This is the name of a man. It is not the same man who wrote the book of Micah. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:translate_names]])
This can be stated in active form. AT: "which someone stole from you" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
"I was the one who took it"
This means to dedicate something to a specific purpose. AT: "dedicate" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
metal that has been melted and poured into a mold to form a special shape
"I give it back to you"
"200 pieces of silver" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:translate_numbers]])

tn.ref: they were placed in the house of Micah
tn.text: The word "they" refers to the metal figures. This may be stated in active form. AT: "Micah placed them in his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
This refers to a house used specifically for worshiping idols. This can be stated clearly. AT: "a house for worshiping idols" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: everyone did what was right in his own eyes
tn.text: Here each person's "eyes" is a metonym for each person's judgment or discretion. AT: "each person did what he decided was right" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"from Bethlehem"
This means that he was living among the family of Judah, that is, the tribe of Judah. AT: "who was living among the tribe of Judah" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: He stayed there to fulfill his duties
tn.text: "He lived and worked there"
"find a different place to live"
It is implied that he is looking for a place to live and work. AT: "where I might live and have a job" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
The word "father" is here used in the sense of an advisor, and not to a literal father. AT: "an advisor and a priest" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
"a set of clothes." This he would receive every year. The missing words may be added. AT: "a suit of clothes each year" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_ellipsis]])

tn.ref: So the Levite went into his house
tn.text: It is implied that the Levite accepted Micah's offer, and therefore, entered his house. AT: "So the Levite accepted his offer and went into his house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

tn.ref: the young man became to Micah like one of his sons
tn.text: The relationship between the Levite and Micah became like the close relationship between a father and son. AT: "the young man became close to Micah and was like one of his sons" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
Here "set apart" means that Micah "dedicated" or "ordained" him. AT: "Micah dedicated the Levite" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_idiom]])
Here living in Micah's house is spoken of as "being" in his house. AT: "lived in Micah's house" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_metonymy]])
